His comments were among the last he made as CEO of the search firm, with Google announcing that co-founder Larry Page would step into Eric Schmidt 's shoes as CEO, while Eric Schmidt becomes executive chairman.

The competition series will allow contestants as young as 12 to audition, a decision Simon Cowell defended on the call after being asked if kids that young should be subjects to public scrutiny. We've started to see a trend with kids this age and what they can do. I like the idea that a 12-year-old on this show can compete with an older singer... times have changed. You have to make a case-by-case decision based on them as a person. Contestants will have to audition before a live audience of 5,000 people in an arena. shake-up. Current Google CEO Eric Schmidt will serve as the company's executive chairman. Co-founder Sergey Brin will devote his time to strategic projects, in particular working on new products, the company said. We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time, Eric Schmidt said in a statement. ''By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. In my clear opinion, Larry is ready to lead and I'm excited

tremendous leader and I have learned innumerable lessons from him.'' Mr Page said Google is just at the ''tip of the iceberg'' of how the internet will change consumers lives in the future. If you think about the next five years of what your online life will be like, we are only just[ getting] started and I am very excited, he added. Mr Eric Schmidt said his new role would concentrate on ''deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships''. It's a cross-silo promotion for Microsoft since Satya Nadella previously worked as senior vice president for research and development in the Online Services division, which runs Bing and MSN. In deciding who should take the business forward, we wanted someone with the right mix of leadership, vision and hard-core engineering chops, Steve Ballmer said in an e-mail to all employees Wednesday. ''We wanted someone who could define the future of business computing and further expand our ability to bring the cloud to business customers and developers in game-changing ways.
